title: Relationship between fair access to public funding of parties and campaign donations and the capacity of the rich to buy elections by the level of electoral integrity

markdown.markdown:
```{=html} ``` ```{r setup, include=FALSE} knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = FALSE, warning = FALSE, message = FALSE, fig.width = 9, fig.height = 7) ``` ```{r} library(tidyverse) library(haven) #library(scales) library(car) library(rgl) library(plotly) library(webshot) ``` ```{r} # Preprocesiing pei <- read_dta("PEI election-level data (PEI_8.0).dta") pei <- pei %>% mutate(gdp_pc_ppp_ln = log(gdp_pc_ppp), PEItype_fct = factor(PEItype, labels = c("Very Low", "Low", "Medium", "High", "Very High")), fh_score = fhcategory + 1, fh_score = factor(fh_score, labels = c("Not Free", "Partly Free", "Free"))) %>% sample_n(479) x_values <- pei$subsidies %>% round(3) y_values <- pei$donations %>% round(3) z_values <- pei$rich %>% round(3) # Define regression plane ------------------------------------------------- # Construct x and y grid elements x_grid <- seq(from = min(x_values, na.rm = TRUE), to = max(x_values, na.rm = TRUE), length = 50) y_grid <- seq(from = min(y_values, na.rm = TRUE), to = max(y_values, na.rm = TRUE), length = 50) # Construct z grid by computing # 1) fitted beta coefficients # 2) fitted values of outer product of x_grid and y_grid # 3) extracting z_grid (matrix needs to be of specific dimensions) beta_hat <- pei %>% #drop_na(rich, subsidies, donations) %>% lm(rich ~ subsidies + donations, data = .) %>% coef() fitted_values <- crossing(y_grid, x_grid) %>% mutate(z_grid = beta_hat[1] + beta_hat[3]*y_grid + beta_hat[2]*x_grid) z_grid <- fitted_values %>% pull(z_grid) %>% matrix(nrow = length(x_grid)) %>% t() # Define text element for each point in plane text_grid <- fitted_values %>% pull(z_grid) %>% round(3) %>% as.character() %>% paste("rich: ", ., sep = "") %>% matrix(nrow = length(x_grid)) %>% t() ``` ```{r} m <- list(l = 0, r = 0, b = 0, t = 0, pad = 4) # Plot using plotly pei %>% plot_ly() %>% add_markers(x = x_values, y = y_values, z = z_values, marker = list(size = 5, opacity = 0.7), symbol = ~PEItype_fct, symbols = c("circle", "square", "x", "diamond", "cross"), color = ~PEItype_fct, colors = "viridis", #colors = hcl.colors(20, "Plasma"), reversescale = TRUE, hoverinfo = 'text', text = ~paste("Country: ", ISO, "
", "Rich: ", z_values, "
", "Donations: ", y_values, "
", "Subsidies: ", x_values )) %>% # Regression plane: add_surface( x = x_grid, y = y_grid, z = z_grid, opacity = 0.8, hoverinfo = 'text', text = text_grid ) %>% # Axes labels and title: layout( scene = list( zaxis = list(title = "y: Rich"), yaxis = list(title = "x2: Donations"), xaxis = list(title = "x1: Subsidies")), legend = list(title=list(text='Electoral
integrity'), font = list(size = 14), y = 0.4), margin = m ) %>% colorbar(title=list(text='Likelyhood
of the rich
to buy elections'), tickfont=list(size=14), y = 0.9) #legend = list(font = list(size = 30)) ``` ```{=html} ``` Note: The plot illustrates the relationship between fair access to state funding of parties and campaign donations (higher values - fairer access), and the capacity of the rich to buy elections (higher values - rich more influential) by the overall level of electoral integrity. It shows that a fairer access to state funding and private contributions is associated with a higher level of electoral integrity and lower ability of the rich to buy elections. Data reflects expert opinions. Use the mouse to rotate/spin, zoom in, and hover over the plot for more details. Data source: [@garnett2022] ::: {#references} :::
